title: BBC Local Live: Coventry & Warwickshire - BBC News
summary: funeral of coventry woman who died working in cyprus .
'one in five ' killed or seriously injured on roads is over 60 .
end of the line for 'longest ' bus route .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 're back from 08:00 on monday with more live news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: spence has a chance this term - mowbray
text: spence has a chance this term - mowbray

documents.title: major 17,000 homes plan for warwick district is back on track
text: plans to build thousands of new homes in leamington and warwick are finally back on track .
author: Warwick Courier

documents.title: speedway : storm lose while bees prepare for belle vue
text: coventry storm speedway team lost 38-52 to isle of wight last night .
the top scorer for the storm was liam carr with 13 points .
tonight the coventry bees face another of the elite league 's title favourites when belle vue aces visit brandon .
it 's nearly five years since the aces were last victorious at brandon - tapes go up at 7.30 .
author: Clive Eakin
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: warwick folk festival this weekend
text: more than 30,000 people are expected in warwick over the weekend as the city 's folk festival welcomes stars from around the world .
the event - worth around half a million pounds to warwick 's economy - is now in its 37th year and organisers say it 's expected to be the biggest yet .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: looking up - the farmers with a towering idea
text: farmers across the midlands are experimenting with a new way to grow fruit and veg.instead of growing strawberries and lettuce in the ground , they are growing them in towers.it 's called hydroponic farming and has been developed over six years by a team at the university of birmingham.one farm at stratford-upon-avon in warwickshire is growing pak choi , while a farm near tamworth is growing strawberries .

documents.title: brexit one month on : have your say
text: if you 're still feeling a little lost and confused about what britain 's decision to brexit means for you , you are n't alone .

a month on from the eu referendum we 're calling in an expert to sort the facts from fiction , looking at what people said would happen and what actually happened and then make a best guess at what is likely to happen as we prepare to leave .
we 've also been interested in hearing from a range of voices from across the west midlands to find out how brexit has affected their daily lives - if at all .

today on the programme we meet the sorge family - a french mum and german dad who were n't allowed to vote but were shocked by brexit - and sutton coldfield window cleaner roger needle who wants to leave the eu .
we 'd love to hear your thoughts too , so share them with us here on facebook or twitter and we 'll try to read as many as we can on the programme tonight .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: more than £ 110k for pupils ' job skills schemes
text: schools and colleges across warwickshire have been given a total of £ 112,000 from the county council to improve pupils ' job skills .
the authority says it 's given up to £ 3,000 to 38 sites in the county since february last year .
the funding 's been used for a range of schemes including new software to help in job searches and getting better work experience .

documents.title: older drivers encouraged to consider road safety
text: warwickshire county council is launching a campaign to advise older drivers on how to stay safe , or know when it 's time to give up altogether .
it 's after figures show one-in-five people killed or seriously injured on warwickshire 's roads over the last three years was over the age of 60 .
the authority says the over-60s are generally safer and slower than young drivers and it would n't want driver re-tests made compulsory .
instead , it is asking other road users to be more considerate and is encouraging older motorists to get their driving checked , voluntarily .

documents.title: latest : fake dvds siezed ; eels get helping hand
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in coventry and warwickshire :
- a tip off has led to a large number of pirate dvds being seized from a shop in coventry
- renewed cctv appeal over street assault
- migrating eels aided by special ladder
author: Rosie Eaton
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: watch : weekend weather forecast
text: showers will die away to leave a dry night across the region , with lengthy clear spells during the early hours .
lows of 17c ( 63f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: fake dvds seized from a shop
text: a tip-off has led to a large number of pirate dvds being seized from a shop in coventry .
officers from trading standards and the police found more than 1,000 illegally copied discs .
trading standards said the quality was `` poor '' and it was obvious some films had been copied while they were being shown at a cinema .
author: Rosie Eaton
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

text: these come from two bbc weather watchers .
the first was taken in coventry by kingfisher whisperer .
the second was taken in royal leamington spa by dave a .

- eel 'ladder ' installed at warwickshire country house

documents.title: nuneaton pub closes due to pest problem
text: a nuneaton pub has been forced to close due to a major pest problem .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: renewed cctv appeal over street assault
text: police have renewed an appeal to trace a man they 're seeking in connection with an assault in coventry .
it happened on 11 september last year when a 44-year-old man was targeted by two men as he walked down webster street .
police believe the person here is known as gagandeep .
anyone with information is asked to contact police .

documents.title: m6 closures this weekend
text: roadworks this weekend - you need to be aware if you 're planning on using the aston expressway and m6 .
full closures m6j6 & a38 ( m ) 8pm fri - 6am mon .
consider public transport .
@ twitterid
every year how shit a job do you do , that you just ca n't get it done properly the first time .

documents.title: weather watchers : cloudy over southam
text: it 's been cooler and cloudier today , as you can see from this photo sent in by one of our bbc weather watchers .
the weather is forecast to stay dry and warm this afternoon .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: as you lick it : new shakespeare stamps
text: our boy will 's reach knows no bounds .
we saw earlier this year a new set of stamps to commemorate the 400th anniversary of shakespeare 's death .
they 're followed by a set for uk overseas territory tristan da cunha - said to be the most remote inhabited island in the world .
it has 267 residents living 1,750 miles from cape town in the south atlantic .

documents.title: summer getaway : top tips for motorway driving
text: if , like a lot of midlanders , you 're thinking about heading down to the south west , it might be worth checking out these top tips for motorway driving .
the big seasonal getaway is moving up a gear and today is one of the busiest days of the year for the motorway network .

documents.title: migrating eels get 'leg up ' with special ladder
text: you would n't think eels had much use for ladders , but every migrating species needs a 'leg up ' now and again .
a 'ladder ' , or 'eel pass ' , is being installed on the weir at warwickshire 's charlecote park .
it 's made from narrow steel tubes that allow the animals to wriggle their way up .
without it , eels in the avon would be cut off from habitats in the river dene .
the £ 3,000 scheme to promote biodiversity is overseen by the environment agency and national trust .

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : tracking the impact of brexit in the west midlands
text: it 's a month since the country voted to leave the european union .
to mark that , we 're planning to follow more than 25 families , individuals and business owners over the next two years as the country grapples with the momentous decision .
this lunchtime we 're going to introduce you to a few of these people - join us from 13:30 on bbc one for midlands today .
author: Nicola Beckford
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: weather watcher packwood and warwick
text: our bbc weather watchers keep us updated with the local weather forecast where they are and upload
here are a couple from the last few hours from users warwick railwayside in warwick and songster from packwood .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: news : 'inadequate ' health body criticised ; hundreds attend holiday rep funeral ; country house getting eel pass
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in coventry and warwickshire :
- the body that organises and pays for gp and hospital services in coventry and rugby is told to improve
- hundreds of people attend the funeral of a woman from coventry who died while working in cyprus earlier this month
- an eel pass is installed on a river near one of warwickshire 's country houses in a bid to encourage migration
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: arson crackdown
text: warwickshire 's fire and rescue service is cracking down on arson over the summer holidays with the roll out of an anti-social behaviour intervention team ( asbit ) .
the programme , which has been running for several years , works at a local level to engage face to face with young people known for setting small fires .
organisers say it 's seen a reduction of more than 40 % in arson-related incidents across the county .
the scheme will target known hotspots in leamington , warwick , kenilworth , southam , stratford and alcester .

documents.title: watch : weather forecast for coventry and warwickshire
text: the bbc weather website also has the latest weather forecasts for coventry and warwickshire .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: hundreds attend funeral for holiday rep lydia lewinson
text: hundreds of people have attended the funeral of a woman from coventry who died while working in cyprus earlier this month .
lydia lewinson , 22 , died in a moped accident while working in the resort of ayia napa
friends raised £ 10,000 in four days on a crowd-funding website to pay for her body to be brought back to the uk .
author: Paul Marriott
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: weather : yellow rain warning for warwickshire
text: the met office is warning of the risk of heavy rain in warwickshire until 22:00 tonight .
yellow warning of rain for west midlands : warwickshire valid from 1110 fri 22 jul to 2200 fri 22 jul

documents.title: the wheels on this bus do n't go round and round
text: first brexit , now this coventry is to withdraw from the continent , or at least lose a prestigious european title .
by prestigious we mean the city will no longer be home to the longest bus route in europe .
the 360 circle comes to the end of the line this weekend and is to be replaced with several new services .
if you 're feeling nostalgic for the 50k loop , take one last ride with us .

documents.title: news : health body in special measures ; road deaths figures highlight over 60s ; rain warning
text: this morning 's headlines include :
- the body that plans health services in coventry and rugby is in special measures until , the nhs says , it can better manage its finances
- about one in five people killed or seriously injured on warwickshire 's roads over the past three years was over the age of 60 , figures highlighted by the county council reveal
- the met office is warning of the risk of heavy rain in warwickshire until 22:00 tonight
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: cricket : bears ' t20 qualification bid
text: the bears will try again to qualify for the t20 blast quarter finals tonight against notts outlaws .
captain ian bell thinks they have the quality to beat anyone despite tuesday 's heavy defeat at northants .
there are no bad teams in this t20 , that 's why it 's a good competition .
i honestly believe that we have the ability in our dressing room to beat anyone but again you ca n't be friendly - out in the field you have to work hard and fight for it
bears vs notts outlaws at edgbaston this friday .
adv tickets £ 19 & u16s free !
# youbears

documents.title: serious crash risk for over 60s in warwickshire , data suggests
text: about one in five people killed or seriously injured on warwickshire 's roads over the past three years was over the age of 60 , figures highlighted by the county council reveal .
it 's prompted the authority to begin a scheme offering advice on how older drivers can stay safe .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: watch : latest forecast for the west midlands
text: a ty british summer - it 's feeling warm today with the odd shower expected in some places .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: on-air debate : how is the nhs treating you ?
text: how is the nhs treating you ?
i want to hear your experiences with gps and hospital services in coventry and warwickshire , good or bad .
we 've heard this morning the organisation that organises and pays for nhs treatment in coventry and rugby has been rated inadequate and is in special measures .
author: Vic Minett
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: hospital and gp waiting lists are 'too long and must improve '
text: waiting lists for gp and hospital services in coventry and rugby are too long and the situation must improve , says coventry city council .
coventry and rugby clinical commissioning group , the body that organises and pays for gp and hospital services , has also been told it is spending too much .
the council says increased demand and spending cuts are among the reasons .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: latest : 'inadequate ' health body criticised ; over 60s accident figures ; dr dj
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in coventry and warwickshire :
-the body that organises and pays for gp and hospital services in coventry and rugby is told to improve
- figures show one in five people killed or seriously injured on warwickshire 's roads over the last three years was over 60
-a trainee doctor from coventry is to be a dj tonight at one of the biggest dance festivals in the world .
author: Paul Marriott
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: major coventry bus route makes its last stop today
text: today marks the end of the line for the longest bus route in europe - coventry 's 360 city circle service .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: travel : accident on m6 northbound between junctions two and three
text: there 's slow traffic on the m6 northbound between j2 , for the m69 , and j3 , at the a444 ( coventry ) , because of an accident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : warm day ahead
text: a bright start across the west midlands this morning , followed by a warm and mostly dry day , with some sunshine too .
however , some may see the odd slow-moving , heavy and perhaps thundery shower during the afternoon - staying warm with highs of 24c ( 75f ) .

documents.title: friday 's live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: good morning .
is that the weekend we can see , over there in the corner , pretending not to notice us ?
we 're here with a mix of news , sport , travel and weather throughout the morning and guess what ?
we 'll even take you into the afternoon and through to evening .
we 'll bring your morning weather forecast soon and let you know how it 's looking on the roads .
until then , sit back , relax and enjoy the fli sorry , wrong 'welcome ' .
but do enjoy .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 're back with more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: rwandan cyclists visit coventry
text: the rwandan national cycling team has been spending a day looking around coventry while taking a break from their tour of britain .
the small group is heading for london tomorrow and coach sterling magnell has described them as the african nation 's `` cream of the crop '' .
he explained they 're preparing to turn professional and were over here for exposure and the experience .

documents.title: rugby : new director aiming to make coventry more competitive
text: coventry rugby club could be a championship outfit but they are currently struggling to compete with sides at the top of national league one .
that 's according to their new director of rugby rowland winter .
he 's told bbc coventry and warwickshire that they 've adopted a more professional approach .
we 're increasing the amount of training hours we 're doing so we can get more content delivered .
that 's so we can actually compete and introduce ideas to the players , develop them so they are up there with those guys that are training more than two hours a week at the top of this division . ''
author: Clive Eakin
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: wetherspoons pub shut down by health inspectors over pest problem
text: health and safety officers have forced a wetherspoons pub in nuneaton to close due to a pest problem .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: shop-bought baby food 'healthier ' then home-made meals
text: home-made meals for babies and toddlers are not always better than shop-bought ones , researchers say .

a study by the universities of warwick and aberdeen found that while home-cooking costs half the price , they actually contain almost treble the levels of saturated fat and salt compared to shop-bought food .
experts also found a greater vegetable variety per meal in ready-made foods , despite a broader range of ingredients overall included in home-cooked recipes .

documents.title: plans to charge for school bus postponed
text: parents in north warwickshire have been told a plan to start charging for their children 's school bus has been postponed .
families in warton have campaigned against the idea to charge £ 375 a year for the two-mile journey to polesworth .
the county council has now promised to keep the service free until at least september 2017 .

documents.title: cathedral cash to repair slate
text: coventry 's cathedral is to get £ 870,000 for slate for its chapel of unity .

the money is part of a £ 14.5m grant , shared between cathedrals nationwide , to mark the centenary of world war one and to repair these `` powerful symbols '' of british history , culture secretary karen bradley said .

documents.title: news : 'garden village ' plans for airfield ; record numbers expected for festival ; special measures status for ccg
text: this afternoon 's headlines include :
- the former site at long marston airfield near stratford could become a 'garden village '
- record numbers of people are expected at warwick folk festival that gets under way tonight
- coventry and rugby ccg is placed in special measures
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: big sam 's career in
text: big sam 's career in
author: Will Chalk
Newsbeat reporter

documents.title: 'inadequate ' ccg placed in special measures
text: the body that plans health care services in coventry and rugby is among nine clinical commissioning groups ( ccgs ) to be placed in special measures today .
the status , which follows an nhs rating of 'inadequate ' , is applied to ccgs that are not meeting their financial commitments .
the nhs says it has taken action to `` sharpen the direct accountability of trusts and ccgs to live within public resources '' .
damian gannon , chairman of coventry city council 's health committee said : `` it is disappointing that the ccg has been placed into special measures .
i will be working with health partners across the city to ensure that everyone is doing what they can to ensure that necessary improvements are made .
`` it is reassuring that the ccg have been open about the difficulties they are facing and have demonstrated their appetite for improvement in recent scrutiny meetings . ''

documents.title: new schools funding scheme to be delayed by a year
text: the implementation of a new national funding formula for schools will be delayed by a year , education secretary justine greening has told mps .
the government had been planning to bring in the new scheme in england from 2017-18 , saying it was needed to address uneven levels of funding across the country .
but ms greening said it would now apply from 2018-19 and told mps she did not want to rush into changes without being sure of their ramifications .
in the 2016-17 financial year , coventry schools were allocated about £ 3,500 per pupil and those in birmingham about £ 5,200 .
labour 's shadow education secretary angela rayner criticised the delay as `` woeful '' .
author: BBC News Education

documents.title: travel : water leak shuts albert street in rugby
text: albert street in rugby is shut both way at the king edward road junction because of a water leak .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: speedway : coventry bees aim to bounce back from poole defeat
text: the coventry bees went down to a 36-56 defeat at poole on a tough night against the defending elite league champions .
a strong display from krzysztof kasprzak was n't enough for the bees .
they now have just four away matches remaining to improve a record of one win on the road this season .
we 'll regroup and aim for big points and a big home win against belle vue .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: signal problem causing rail delays
text: a signalling problem at banbury is causing disruption to rail services in birmingham and warwickshire , network rail says .
delays of up to an hour can be expected .

documents.title: folk festival expecting record crowds
text: record numbers of people are expected at the warwick folk festival , which gets under way tonight .
the main programme of the festival , which is in its 37th year , is taking place at warwick boys school .
coventry and warwickshire will be live at the event on friday afternoon and again on sunday .
we 've got 46 events in the town - we 've got a big event in the market square on saturday and sunday and all the pubs have got events on . ''
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: three months ' construction in seconds
text: three months ' construction in seconds

documents.title: west midlands mayor : consultation reminder
text: have your say
have your say on the possible roles and responsibilities of a new mayor for the west midlands # wmcaconsultation

documents.title: home nations football : the coventry connection
text: with former sky blues player sam allerdyce set to become england manager , it means all four home nation teams have a coventry city connection .
wales boss chris coleman managed the club between 2008 and 2010 and scotland 's gordon strachan played for and managed the sky blues .
northern ireland 's michael o'neill appeared for coventry city five times during his two years with the club .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: twycross zoo begins great ape heart disease study
text: experts looking at why apes are susceptible to heart disease while in the care of humans believe it 's not linked to poor diet .
it 's hoped the project at twycross zoo will uncover the specific type of heart disease affecting the animals .
dr victoria strong , from the university of nottingham 's school of veterinary medicine and sciences , said : `` at the moment we 're unsure why great apes in human care develop heart disease . ''

documents.title: chiltern railways : government urged to give rail companies longer contracts
text: the government is being urged to give rail companies longer contracts in an effort to improve the standard of service to passengers .
it comes as chiltern railways celebrates its 20th anniversary , having spent more than £ 600m on improvements .
chiltern , which runs trains in the west midlands and warwickshire , currently has a 20-year franchise , one of the longest ever awarded to a rail company .
see more on bbc one at 13:30 .
author: Peter Plisner
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: children 's home manager on trial accused of historical sex abuse
text: the former manager of a children 's home in nuneaton has gone on trial accused of historical sex abuse of children .
robert brown , who 's 68 and from caistor-on-sea in norfolk , denies 23 charges of indecent assault and cruelty in relation to eight children at the manor court home in the 1970s .
author: Rosie Eaton
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: weather watcher leamington and rugby
text: as coventry and warwickshire 's been basking in sunshine , our bbc weather watchers have been busy taking photos across the area .
these two are from users stonechat in royal leamington spa and graham hedges in rugby .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: latest : airfield 'garden village ' plan ; historical sex abuse trail ; folk festival begins
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in coventry and warwickshire :
- the former site at long marston airfield near stratford could become a 'garden village '
- the former manager of a children 's home in nuneaton has gone on trial accused of historical sex abuse of young people
- record numbers expected at warwick folk festival which begins tonight
author: Paul Marriott
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: horror as toddler burned on skate ramp in scorching sunshine
text: a toddler needed burns treatment after touching a skate ramp that had reached a sizzling 51 degrees celsius in the sunshine .
author: Atherstone & Coleshill Herald

documents.title: hydrants being used illegally in coventry
text: water hydrants in the wood end area of coventry have been illegally opened , leading to a loss of water supply , says severn trent .
the company has issued a warning after customers in the area complained about problems with not only supply but discolouration .
it says illegal hydrant use is a particular issue during hot weather and wastes a `` huge amout '' of water and can also cause problems for fire and rescue services .

documents.title: plans for new 'garden village ' at airfield
text: a 'garden village ' comprising 2,000 new homes could be built on the site of the long marston airfield in south warwickshire .
an expression of interest is to be submitted by stratford district council for the new settlement before the deadline of 31 july .
the council says the government scheme offers infrastucture funding for developments that meet certain criteria , such as building at brownfield sites .
previous plans for a 6,000 dwelling eco-town on the site were turned down .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bidder chosen to re-open 'city 's birthplace ' venue after our campaign
text: the re-opening of the 'internationally important ' lady godiva-founded priory visitor centre has moved a step closer following the observer 's campaign - with the selection of an organisation to step in and run it .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: chiltern railways anniversary
text: chiltern railways which operates trains across the west midlands is celebrating its 20th anniversary .
in the last two decades , the company has invested more than £ 600m in the network with more than 6m passengers travelling a year .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: leamington man in nice terror attack rescue
text: on this week 's front page : an engineer from leamington caught up in the nice terror attack has told how he rescued an elderly man from being trampled .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: rugby : wasps name squad for premiership sevens
text: wasps have named a 12-man squad for the singha premiership rugby 7s which will be hosted at sandy park this saturday .
the squad includes tom cruse , brendan macken , rob miller , craig hampson and josh bassett ( who will captain the side .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

text: we 're back from 08:00 with more news , sport , travel and weather updates , but keep an eye out here for breaking news during the evening and into the morning .

documents.title: one of the wonders of the west midlands was almost never built
text: it 's one of the wonders of the west midlands - the edstone aqueduct in warwickshire is 200 years old and the longest in england at almost 500 feet .
it was almost never built though , as i found out earlier .
author: Joan Cummins
Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: on midlands today at 18:30 : a warwickshire wonder
text: this evening on bbc midlands today we 'll hear from an inquest into the deaths of five men who were killed after a wall collapsed on them .
we 'll also hear a warning from police in the region of the dangers of carrying replica guns in public - and about one of the wonders of warwickshire .
all these stories and much more on bbc one from 18:30 .
author: Mary Rhodes
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: m6 crash : car 'rolled several times onto carriageway '
text: a stretch of the m6 between rugby and coventry was closed for several hours earlier following a crash .
the fire service has detail on this morning 's collision between junctions 2 and 1 - since reopened .
a spokesperson for warwickshire fire and rescue service said : `` the vehicle had left the northbound carriageway and rolled several times onto the southbound carriageway .
two people were trapped in the vehicle .
`` crews from nuneaton and bedworth used hydraulic cutting equipment to rapidly extricate the casualties .
one casualty was taken via land ambulance and one via air ambulance .

`` crews from fire , ambulance , air ambulance , police and highways worked extremely hard as a multi-agency team in very hot and difficult conditions to save the lives of those involved in the incident . ''

documents.title: weather watcher sunshine in fazeley and biddulph
text: the sunshine 's brought out plenty of great from our bbc weather watcher volunteers .

documents.title: mystery as head teacher put on gardening leave
text: the head teacher of a coventry faith school has been put on gardening leave .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: west midlands mep 'would back return of the death penalty '
text: west midlands mep and ukip leadership candidate bill etheridge says there should be a referendum on the death penalty and he would back its reintroduction .

he said : for my part i believe that the very worst crimes deserve the ultimate penalty and i propose that those who murder and rape children , those that commit sadistic acts of murder and torture and those that commit acts of murder through terrorism against our country or our people should be subject to the death penalty at the discretion of the presiding judge . ''

the mep , who stood in 2012 as ukip 's police & crime commissioner candidate in the west midlands police force area , also said three strikes should mean `` life behind bars for violent criminals '' .
the death penalty is opposed by the uk government , amnesty international , the un , the european union and 16 us states .
author: Rob Mayor
Black Country Political Reporter, BBC WM

documents.title: warwickshire aqueduct praised on 200th birthday
text: england 's longest aqueduct has been praised as it celebrates its 200th birthday .
the edstone aqueduct in warwickshire is almost 500 feet ( 152m ) long and grade ii listed .
a lack of money and competition from railways meant it was almost never built .
but canal experts say the cast iron structure has become a jewel in the west midlands ' crown - and i 'll have a report on this wonder of the region on bbc one from 18:30 on midlands today .
author: Joan Cummins
Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: ice hockey : blaze make bombis signing
text: coventry blaze have signed the german forward björn bombis .
the 33-year-old has played all of his professional career in the del in germany and he 'll play right-wing for the blaze .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: woman seriously hurt in m6 crash
text: an ambulance taking a patient to hospital came to the aid of a woman seriously injured in a crash on the m6 earlier .
the crew stopped at the scene and helped the woman , who had been inside a car that went across the central reservation .
she suffered many serious injuries , the ambulance service said , and was taken to hospital along with a man in the same car who hurt his shoulder and arm .
the crash happened between junctions one and two , temporarily closing a stretch of the motorway both ways between rugby and coventry .

documents.title: alas , poor theatre goers
text: a royal shakespeare company performance of hamlet had to be cancelled due to soaring temperatures .
to be or not to be - that was the question bosses asked about the show when the cooling system was hit by a technical problem .
the decision was then taken to cancel last night 's performances of both hamlet and the alchemist , which was set for the swan theatre adjoining the stratford-upon-avon venue .
this evening 's performances will go ahead .

a spokesperson said : `` we have been able to increase the cooling capacity and continue to work on improvements , but please note that the auditoria will be warmer than usual , as a result of the extraordinary external temperature . ''

documents.title: football : coventry prepare for 'big final push ' after rugby win
text: coventry city beat rugby town 2-1 in a pre-season friendly at butlin road last night which has been called a good exercise for a young side .
kyle spence and george thomas scored the sky blues ' goals after david kolodynski gave rugby the lead .
with manager tony mowbray on a scouting mission , first team coach jamie clapham was in charge of the coventry side .
we can come in today , train as normal and then we 've got thursday , friday , leading into a big final push really before the season starts and have an assessment of the squad . ''
author: Clive Eakin
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: m6 : lanes reopen
text: good news for motorists
all lanes are now open on # m6 j1 - j2 ( nr # rugby ) in both directions , following an earlier collision .
delays are easing , in both directions .

documents.title: unemployment increases in west midlands
text: unemployment across the west midlands has gone up .
in the march-to-may period , 165,000 people were out of work in the region - an increase of 13,000 on the previous quarter .
in contrast , figures for the whole of the uk show a fall of 54,000 to 1.65 million .
author: Alice Bentley
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: watch : weather for the rest of today
text: the bbc weather website also has the latest forecasts .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: tom allin inquest : he had 'several tough months ' say parents
text: the parents of a former warwickshire county cricketer - found to have taken his own life - told an inquest he had been through .
`` several tough months '' leading up to his death .
tony and beverley allin said son tom 's personal problems began when his brother was seriously ill .
the court also heard that tom had been in a road accident and had to be cut from his car , and while he was `` recovering well physically '' he had told a nurse his mood was `` up and down '' .
author: Elisabeth Mahy
BBC News Online

documents.title: coming up on tv
text: an inquest has been opened and adjourned into the deaths of five men who were killed after a wall collapsed on them at hawkeswood metal recycling plant in birmingham - we report on the case .
and £ 154,000 would buy you a house today but in 1816 it was the small fortune needed to complete a transport network in the region .
we discover a record-breaking legacy of that building project 200 years later .
join us for the midlands today on bbc one at 13:30 .
author: Nicola Beckford
Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: `` serious collision '' closes m6 between rugby and coventry
text: warwickshire police says it 's a `` serious collision '' that 's closed the m6 in north warwickshire .
it happened shortly after 11.30am on the southbound carriageway , closing the motorway in both directions between junction 1 ( rugby ) and junction 2 ( coventry ) .
an air ambulance attended the scene .
a spokesperson says motorists are advised to find alternative routes .

- people are being warned not to carry replica guns in public

more from highways england here .

documents.title: flood risk details
text: this must surely be britain - one day you 're basking in scorching sunshine , the next you 're hearing storm warnings .
but after a spate of wet weather caused localised flooding across warwickshire earlier this year , what do such forecasts mean for us ?
environment agency midlands says there 's a low flood risk overall '' , but urban areas may see drains overwhelmed '' by this evening .
click on the image to read more about the projection for our part of the country .
latest on today 's storms & # flood risk - stay # floodaware

documents.title: firearms : can you tell the difference between replica and real ?
text: it 's a split second decision that armed officers have to make , but how would you fare ?
between april 1 and july 17 this year , west midlands police received 81 emergency calls from members of the public who reported seeing people with firearms that turned out to be bb or air guns .
the replicas , though , look just like the real thing and it 's led to a force warning that they should never be carried in public .
real or fake ?
an # afo has about 0.7 secs 2 decide .
read about an increase in firearm scares
ultimately if carry anything that resembles a firearm with out good course you may get shot by a afo .
life is precious
i think the first is a bb gun but i am no professional

documents.title: cctv appeal over city centre assault
text: here 's an image of a woman west midlands police wants to trace in connection with an assault in coventry city centre .
the 25-year-old victim was at a bar on warwick road with his partner on 28 may .
he got into an argument with a woman as he left the venue at 2.10am .
he walked away but was chased by the person with whom he 'd been arguing .
she grabbed his arm and threw him to the floor , resulting in a bloody nose .
anyone with information is asked to contact pc greg ashfield from force cid on 101 or email contactus @ west-midlands.pnn.police.uk .

documents.title: former nuneaton care home manager on trial for alleged sexual abuse
text: the former manager of a nuneaton children 's home has gone on trial accused of sexually abusing five boys at the home in the 1970s and cruelty to other children .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: airguns carried in public prompting armed police response
text: between april 1 and july 17 , west midlands police received 81 emergency calls from worried members of the public who reported seeing people with weapons that turned out to be bb guns or air weapons .
the force has been warning that replica firearms should never be carried in public amid the spate of scares that were false alarms .
det insp jim colclough said : `` some of these air weapons are very realistic it 's difficult to tell them apart from the real thing .
`` we always want people to report their concerns to us ; the last thing we want is a blase attitude and someone assuming it 's probably a bb gun .

our armed officers always have to treat callouts seriously , they ca n't let their guard down and would treat the incident as a genuine threat until it becomes apparent they are n't dealing with a live firearm .

`` we 're reaching out to parents , teenagers and schools to hammer home the message that anyone carrying or using a bb gun in public could quickly find themselves at the centre of an armed response by firearms officers . ''

documents.title: police warning over replica firearms
text: replica firearms carried in public have caused `` a spate of scares '' , with armed officers called recently to more than 80 false alarms , west midlands police says .
it 's led to the force issuing a warning that air-powered and bb weapons should never be displayed on the street as onlookers are mistaking them for the real thing .
between april 1 and july 17 , west midlands police received 81 emergency calls from members of the public who reported seeing people with firearms that turned out to be bb or air guns .

documents.title: cricket : bears miss out on chance to qualify for t20 blast knockouts
text: another batting collapse saw the birmingham bears miss the chance to qualify for the knockout stages of the t20 blast last night .
warwickshire 's t20 side can still make the quarter finals , but will need to win at least one if not both of their final two matches after losing by 74 runs at northants .
the steelbacks make 200 for 5 in their 20 overs , with ian bell 's side bowled out for 126 and the captain said losing seven wickets in 15 balls was not good enough .
author: Mikey Burrows
BBC WM Sport

documents.title: controversy over new coffee shop planned for warwick
text: plans for a new coffee shop in warwick have been given the go-ahead despite opposition from people in the town .
councillors have given permission for the former warwick antiques centre to be taken over by a national chain .
jason critchell , who runs merchants in swan street , told us he felt the town had enough cafes already .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: coventry window manufacturing firm goes bust with loss of around 30 jobs
text: coventry window company emperor windows has closed down with creditors set to decide later this week whether the company will go into liquidation .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: concern over changes to treatment for blood disorders
text: there 's concern among people in coventry and warwickshire who are being treated for blood disorders .
it is because the nhs has changed the rules on bone marrow and stem cell transplants , meaning in the future , patients can only get one round of treatment .
after that , they need to apply for extra funding .
author: Paul Marriott
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: travel : queuing traffic in roadworks area
text: in coventry , there 's queuing traffic on the a46 southbound in binley , between t.g.i island and tollbar island in the roadworks area .
author: BBC Travel
